data.title: How Quicksand Works, and Much More: The Secrets of Everything
data.meta_description: Films Media Group, an Infobase Learning Company, is the premier source of high-quality academic streaming video and DVDs for schools, colleges, and libraries.
data.text:
Broken Heart (04:19)

FREE PREVIEW

Can a person die of a broken heart? A heart is dissected from a pig corpse; human hearts and pig hearts are very similar. Archival film footage shows a variety of scenes from old movies from a man choking and smoking to a Spanish dancer and her lover/hero.

Quicksand Survival (05:23)

Can we escape from quicksand? Quicksand is a "non-Newtonian" liquid. Under the pressure of a foot, quicksand gets runnier. Yet, the foot is very difficult to remove. It takes a "skip lorry" to pull a dummy out. It is generally not possible to drown in quicksand. The danger lies in a tide coming in while a person is stuck. We learn a technique from escaping quicksand.

Hot Air Rises? (04:58)

If hot air rises, why are mountain tops cold? We learn how pressure affects temperature with the help of a thermal camera. A demonstration with a refrigerator helps viewers understand the principles involves in air expansion and compression.

What Are Black Holes? (02:20)

We learn what a black hole is and how it can be "seen" from Earth. Are black holes gateways to other universes?

Fast Food and Obesity (04:22)

Does fast food make you fat? The film host loads up with calories (7,000 a day) to prove whether fast food makes us fat. We learn what a calorie is. Weight for weight, fast food tends to contain a third as much fat than a healthier meal. To what extent does a heavy workout burn calories?

Digging to Australia (05:41)

We learn about Earth's molten core and high air pressure. Is it possible to dig to Australia? Absolutely not. The film host experiences a high pressure environment? His voice changes radically, and he has trouble thinking straight. Increased nitrogen has negative effects on humans.

Credits: How Quicksand Works, and Much More: The Secrets of Everything (00:26)

Credits: How Quicksand Works, and Much More: The Secrets of Everything
